result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael L. SKATTEBO

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
State moves to dismiss and read in this charge.  Defendant entered pleas in Case Files 14 CF 274, 15 CF 185 and 15 CF 383.   Motion granted.   
$50.00 cash bail applied to case 14 CF 274.   
Minutes.

The report has been received and reviewed by all parties.  The report finds the defendant competent to proceed in these matter.
The parties do not contest these findings.  The defendant agrees he is competent to proceed.
The court sets a plea date for 09-24-15 at 1:15 p.m. for all pending cases.  He requests that an outline of the plea agreement be filed prior to that date.
Minutes.

of Jenna Hernke, Psy. D. 
located in case 15CF13.

ADDRESS INFO for Michael L. SKATTEBO
Current: 2319 - 12th Street, Two Rivers, WI 54241 United States  (Effective: 07-16-2015)
Prior: 1607 19th Street, Two Rivers, WI 54241 United States
Hearing is set for 08-27-15 at 8:30 a.m.

The matters were set for a plea hearing today. Attorney Ritter informs the Court that the defendant does not want to proceed to a plea and sentencing and wants these matters set for jury trial.
Attorney Ritter also feels he has an ethical duty to inform the court that he is raising the issue of competency  at this time.  The defendant seems to be having a hard time understanding the legal procedure involved with these matters.  He asks the Court to order a competency evaluation.
The Court orders a competency examination of the defendant on all pending files, even the two that are Judge Fox's  and orders the Wisconsin Forensic Unit to conduct the examination.
The Court will draft the necessary order.
(Per Robbie, Judge Fox's cases will just ride along with Branch 1's files.  No specific competency order needs to be done on those two cases)
Minutes.

Defendant's Notice of Change of Address.
Cover letter.

Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 1 for trial.

Information filed.  Copy served on defense counsel.
Not guilty plea entered.  Jury calendar.
Plea date is set for 07-07-15 at 1:30 p.m.
Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant demands a preliminary hearing and waives the statutory time period within which a preliminary hearing must be held.  Preliminary hearing is set for 05-05-15 at 3:30 p.m.   
Minutes.

ADDRESS INFO for Michael L. SKATTEBO
Current: c/o Manitowoc County Jail, Manitowoc, WI 54220 United States  (Effective: 04-13-2015)
Prior: 1607 19th Street, Two Rivers, WI 54241

Defendant in custody.   
Defendant requests counsel and is referred to the public defender.  Initial appearance is reset to 04-27-15 at 2:30 p.m.   Bail is set at $50.00 cash with the conditions that defendant must report to the Two Rivers Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and identifying information within 24 hours of release and defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.   Bail not furnished.  Defendant is remanded to the county jail.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed.    
Minutes.

Initial appearance is set for 04-13-15 at 2:30 p.m.
